Award.AwardTitle: Support for US Participation in ICMMES-2015 (Beijing, China, July 20-24, 2015)

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
1549614(Luo)

The proposal seeks funds to partially cover travel expenses of graduate students, post-doctoral researchers, and junior faculty members from institutions in the United States to participate in the International Conference for Mesoscopic Methods in Engineering and Science (ICMMES) that will be held July 20-24, 2015 at the Beijing Computational Science Research Center, Beijing, China. An objective of this proposal is to increase US participation in ICMMES and to strengthen the leadership position of US in this fast-growing and promising research field.

The main intellectual merit of this conference lies in the exchange of scientific ideas, presentations of cutting edge research, and exposure to a richly diverse array of topics in the area of mesoscopic fluid dynamics. The conference organization is in direct response to the growing interest in multi-scale and multi-physics phenomena observed in nano- or micro-systems and biological systems, and the increasing importance of computational science to research in these disciplines. The conference will be attended by both prominent and young scientists in fluid dynamics, applied and computational mathematics, physics, and computer science, from around the world, who will be discussing research challenges in mesoscopic methods, the theory and modeling of bringing the scales from the molecular to the macroscopic. These methods are promising candidates to effectively connect microscopic and macroscopic physics and thereby substantially extend our analytical and computational capabilities. The focus of ICMMES is mesoscopic/kinetic methods (e.g., lattice Boltzmann equation, lattice gas cellular automata, discrete velocity models, gas-kinetic schemes, dissipative particle dynamics, smoothed particle hydrodynamics, and various novel methods) for computational mechanics in its broadest sense.The broader impact will be to increase participation of students and young scientists who would not otherwise be able to afford to travel to the meeting and pay associated costs. Special consideration will be given to under-represented minorities, women, persons with disabilities, and those in Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) and Hispanic Serving Institutions (HSI).

POR.DRECONTENT:
The International Conference on Mesoscopic Methods in Engineering and Science (ICMMES, http://www.icmmes.org) is a 5-day conference devoted to mesoscopic methods and their applications in engineering and science. ICMMES is unique not only in its scientific focuses, but also in its emphasis in education and training. The first day of the conference is dedicated to short courses for graduate students, junior faculties and the researchers new to the field. The short courses are given by renowned experts in the field. The short courses maintain a balance between theory and applications, and analysis and computation. The short courses are also intended to bring students up-to-date in frontier research.

The 12th ICMMES had 16 sessions of over 100 oral presentations and one poster session of 14 poster presentations in 4 days, July 21--24, 2015. The number of oral presentations and the total number of accepted abstracts in ICMMES-2015 is highest ever. ICMMES-2015 presented seven invited speakers who are renowned experts in various fields in applied and computational mathematics, mesoscopic methods, non-equilibrium statistical physics, and complex fluids.  Among the contributions, 12 oral contributions were from the USA and 10 contributors were supported by the NSF Grant CBET-1549614. The priority consideration is given first to graduate students,
post-doctoral researchers, and junior faculties. We also pay special attention to under-represented groups (e.g., women, under-represented minority groups, and persons with disabilities). Among the 13 applicants, seven are graduate students, one is post-doctoral researcher, and two are junior faculty members. Among them, three are female.

A wide range of topics have been covered by these presentations including: theory and analysis of mesoscopic methods, such as dissipative particle dynamics (DPD), smooth particle hydrodynamics (SPH), lattice Boltzmann equation (LBE); high performance computing (HPC) in the context of mesoscopic methods; modeling and simulation by using mesoscopic methods including turbulence simulations, the lattice Boltzmann model for magnetohydrodynamics, flows through porous media, biofluids, complex fluids, micro-flows, thermal and convective flows; and engineering applications of mesoscopic methods (e.g., fuel cells, secondary oil recovery in porous media, etc.). The information about the ICMMES-2015 is available online on the ICMMES website: https://www.icmmes.org/icmmes2015

The ICMMES-2015 proceedings will be published as special issues of "Computers & Fluids" (CAF) and "Computers & Mathematics with Applications" (CAMWA). ICMMES-2015 has received more than 40 papers which are under review.  All the papers submitted to the ICMMES-2015 proceedings have been subject to a two-step review process: first by editors of the ICMMES proceedings to determine if a submission is acceptable for the proceedings and to which journal, and second by the rigorous peer review process stipulated by the Editorial Offices of the Journals.  It is expected that the review process will be completed by beginning of 2017, and the proceedings will be published
in CAF and CAMWA by sometime in 2017.
